channel.title: Java 2D experiments
channel.description:
Well, i decided i would stay up all night, and i got bored so i started screwing with java 2D :)
I made 3 simple programs, all using what i will be using for future programs. I just want to know what i could have done to make things easier, and other things :) Basically just corrections. When i can't get something to work i usually go Boolean crazy, for me, enough of them works :P.
Also, How can i get the mouseX and [b]not[/b] not let it update again. Like if i was using x, and x was e.getX();, then at one point i want it to stop updating and freeze the int at that number.
Code probably does look like crap, don't totally care right now but it shouldn't be to hard to read.
Attached.

item.title: Java 2D experiments
item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

okay, nice. I see you posted the src, i’ll have a look at it and see how you did it, I’m curious.

Read full topic

item.title: Java 2D experiments
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“supamagier, post:9, topic:214424”]dude wtf?

x = e.getX(); y = e.getY(); y -= 30; x -= 40; x2 = e.getX(); y2 = e.getY(); [br][br][size=1]Posted on: 25 June 2008, 07:36:51[/size][hr][quote author=Frell link=topic=282094.msg2295626#msg2295626 date=1214379984]

…

Im screwing with java 3d right now, im loading .obj
Fucking confusing though.


top view of a platebody…

I need to get it to rotate, after i can get the 3d content into the JFrame, so i can get a menubar
[/quote]
The rotate is the hard part, if you can’t make a simple bugfree class to draw stupid circle, how the hell you could make a 3d object rotate.[/quote]
I got it to rotate about an hour ago…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

dude wtf?

x = e.getX(); y = e.getY(); y -= 30; x -= 40; x2 = e.getX(); y2 = e.getY(); [br][br][size=1]Posted on: 25 June 2008, 07:36:51[/size][hr][quote=“Frell, post:7, topic:214424”]…

Im screwing with java 3d right now, im loading .obj
Fucking confusing though.


top view of a platebody…

I need to get it to rotate, after i can get the 3d content into the JFrame, so i can get a menubar[/quote]
The rotate is the hard part, if you can’t make a simple bugfree class to draw stupid circle, how the hell you could make a 3d object rotate.

Read full topic

item.title: Java 2D experiments
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:5, topic:214424”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=282094.msg2295085#msg2295085 date=1214358686]

x = e.getX(); y = e.getY(); y -= 30; x -= 7;
wat
[/quote]
For some reason when it draws the shape at a certain coordinates it draws it below, and a little bit to the right of the pointer. I had to subtract what it added to get it right on the point.[/quote]You can put all of that into one line is what I was 'wat’ing at

Read full topic

item.title: Java 2D experiments
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:6, topic:214424”][quote author=Frell link=topic=282094.msg2295142#msg2295142 date=1214360654]

x = e.getX(); y = e.getY(); y -= 30; x -= 7;
wat

For some reason when it draws the shape at a certain coordinates it draws it below, and a little bit to the right of the pointer. I had to subtract what it added to get it right on the point.
[/quote]
probably cuz ur doing it right on the frame insted of a panel[/quote]
That was what i was doing

Im screwing with java 3d right now, im loading .obj
Fucking confusing though.


top view of a platebody…

I need to get it to rotate, after i can get the 3d content into the JFrame, so i can get a menubar

Read full topic

item.description:
@Frell wrote:

I started then, but after a few things i stopped with java(Got addicted to rs again). I’ve never had a chance to experiment with 2D graphics.

And i used netbeans for everything, that didn’t help me learn much either.

Read full topic
